text.content:
Velkynvelve (Chapter 1)

Theme: Fear, captivity, planning, and escape.

Your job: Make the outpost feel alive but never hopeless. Always leave at least one possible way forward.

  • Use Patrol Ticks to keep pressure up
  • Use the Alarm Track to pace danger
  • Let NPC prisoners suggest ideas

Possible Escape Routes

  • Waterfall Tunnel: Quiet but slippery. Sound is masked.
  • Rope Lifts: Risky but fast with good planning.
  • Bridges: Most direct and most dangerous.

You awaken in a hanging cage of webbing and iron. The air is cold and damp. Far below, water crashes endlessly into darkness.

You have no weapons. No armor. Only your wits—and the strangers trapped beside you.

• Stool: Gentle, curious, helpful through spores.
  • Jimjar: Constantly betting, oddly perceptive.
  • Eldeth: Practical, disciplined, escape-focused.
  • Ront: Bully, responds to strength.
  • Shuushar: Pacifist, wants no violence.
  • Derendil: Regal delusions, unstable.
  • Sarith: Knows survival but keeps secrets.
  • Buppido: Cheerful in unsettling ways.

• Ilvara: Cold, calculating priestess. Directs the hunt.
  • Shoor: Brutal enforcer. Loves open violence.
  • Jorlan: Disgraced officer. May sabotage patrols.
